description: Type-safe, real-time API framework for TypeScript with live queries, incremental updates via JSON Patch, and serverless-first architecture using HTTP + SSE
rules: Lens uses HTTP for queries/mutations and SSE for real-time subscriptions - NOT WebSocket by default
Always use .subscribe() for real-time updates, not polling
Models are defined with model() and operations with query()/mutation() - similar to tRPC but with field selection
Use emit.invalidate() or emit.update() to trigger live query updates on the server
Field selection uses GraphQL-like syntax: { select: { fieldName: true, nested: { select: {...} } } }
For serverless deployment, use createHandler() for HTTP and streaming responses for SSE
Lens is serverless-first - prefer HTTP+SSE transport over WebSocket for better cold start handling
JSON Patch is used automatically for incremental updates - no manual diff computation needed
Use @sylphx/lens-server for server, @sylphx/lens-client for client, @sylphx/lens-react etc for framework bindings
